title: Financial Projections
subtitle: Financial projections are essential for planning and monitoring a companyâ€™s performance. They provide insights into potential revenue, expenses, and profitability over specific periods.

values.title: The Balance Sheet
values.description: The Balance Sheet is a summary of the assets and liabilities and equity of a business at a specific point of time.

values.title: Income Statement
values.description: The Income (Profit and Loss) Statement, commonly referred to as the P&L statement, summarizes the revenue and expenses for a specific time period (one month, one quarter, one year, etc.).

values.title: Financial Plan
values.description: Keep your information current and review the documents on a regular basis (monthly or more often if needed). Review them with key individuals within your company.

values.title: Financial Ratios
values.description: Ratios are useful when comparing your company with the competition on financial performance and also when benchmarking the performance of your company.
